text: In Bahrain, the prime minister is the head of government of the country. According to the Constitution of Bahrain, the prime minister is appointed directly by the King, and needs not to be an elected member of the Council of Representatives. ==List of rulers== The Arabic title of the Hakim, as transliterated, was Hakim al-Bahrayn (). The Hakim also held the honorific title of sheikh. Portrait Name Term of office Sheikh Ahmed bin Muhammad bin Khalifa 1783 – 18 July 1795 Sheikh Salman bin Ahmad Al Khalifa 1795–1825 Sheikh Abdullah bin Ahmad Al Khalifa 1795–1843 Sheikh Khalifa bin Sulman Al Khalifa 1825–1834 Sheikh Muhammad bin Khalifa Al Khalifa 1834–1842 Sheikh Muhammad bin Khalifa Al Khalifa 1843–1868 Sheikh Ali bin Khalifa Al Khalifa 1868–1869 Sheikh Muhammad bin Khalifa Al Khalifa 1869 Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdullah Al Khalifa September – 1 December 1869 Sheikh Isa bin Ali Al Khalifa 1 December 1869 – 26 May 1923 Sheikh Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa 27 May 1923 – 20 February 1942 Sheikh Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa 20 February 1942 – 2 November 1961 Sheikh Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa 2 November 1961 – 10 January 1970 Sheikh Khalifa bin Salman Al Khalifa 10 January 1970 – 11 November 2020 Prince Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa 11 November 2020 — ==References== Category:Prime ministers of Bahrain Category:1970 establishments in Asia Category:Politics of Bahrain
title: Prime Minister of Bahrain
